title: Guo Wei, a court official, leads a military coup and declares himself emperor of the new Later Zhou.
text: Guo Wei, a court official, leads a military coup and declares himself emperor of the new Later Zhou.

title: Emperor Otto I and Pope John XII co-sign the Diploma Ottonianum, recognizing John as ruler of Rome.
text: Emperor Otto I and Pope John XII co-sign the Diploma Ottonianum, recognizing John as ruler of Rome.

title: The central tower of Ely Cathedral falls on the night of 12th–13th.
text: The central tower of Ely Cathedral falls on the night of 12th–13th.

title: The Treaty of Westminster is finalised between Edward IV of England and the Scottish Lord of the Isles.
text: The Treaty of Westminster is finalised between Edward IV of England and the Scottish Lord of the Isles.

title: Challenge of Barletta: Tournament between 13 Italian and 13 French knights near Barletta.
text: Challenge of Barletta: Tournament between 13 Italian and 13 French knights near Barletta.

title: Catherine Howard, the fifth wife of Henry VIII of England, is executed for adultery.
text: Catherine Howard, the fifth wife of Henry VIII of England, is executed for adultery.

title: Henry III of France is crowned at Reims.
text: Henry III of France is crowned at Reims.

title: Galileo Galilei arrives in Rome for his trial before the Inquisition.
text: Galileo Galilei arrives in Rome for his trial before the Inquisition.

title: With the accession of young Charles XI of Sweden, his regents begin negotiations to end the Second Northern War.
text: With the accession of young Charles XI of Sweden, his regents begin negotiations to end the Second Northern War.

title: William and Mary are proclaimed co-rulers of England.
text: William and Mary are proclaimed co-rulers of England.

title: Massacre of Glencoe: Almost 80 Macdonalds at Glen Coe, Scotland are killed early in the morning for not promptly pledging allegiance to the new king, William of Orange.
text: Massacre of Glencoe: Almost 80 Macdonalds at Glen Coe, Scotland are killed early in the morning for not promptly pledging allegiance to the new king, William of Orange.

title: Battle of Karnal: The army of Iranian ruler Nader Shah defeats the forces of the Mughal emperor of India, Muhammad Shah.
text: Battle of Karnal: The army of Iranian ruler Nader Shah defeats the forces of the Mughal emperor of India, Muhammad Shah.

title: Treaty of Giyanti signed by VOC, Pakubuwono III and Prince Mangkubumi. The treaty divides the Javanese kingdom of Mataram into 2: Sunanate of Surakarta and Sultanate of Yogyakarta.
text: Treaty of Giyanti signed by VOC, Pakubuwono III and Prince Mangkubumi. The treaty divides the Javanese kingdom of Mataram into 2: Sunanate of Surakarta and Sultanate of Yogyakarta.

title: The delegation headed by Metropolitan bishop Andrei Șaguna hands out to the Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria the General Petition of Romanian leaders in Transylvania, Banat and Bukovina, which demands that the Romanian nation be recognized.
text: The delegation headed by Metropolitan bishop Andrei Șaguna hands out to the Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria the General Petition of Romanian leaders in Transylvania, Banat and Bukovina, which demands that the Romanian nation be recognized.

title: In Gaeta the capitulation of the fortress decreeing the end of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies is signed.
text: In Gaeta the capitulation of the fortress decreeing the end of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies is signed.

title: Work begins on the covering of the Senne, burying Brussels's primary river and creating the modern central boulevards.
text: Work begins on the covering of the Senne, burying Brussels's primary river and creating the modern central boulevards.

title: Thomas Edison observes Thermionic emission.
text: Thomas Edison observes Thermionic emission.

title: The 13th Dalai Lama proclaims Tibetan independence following a period of domination by Manchu Qing dynasty and initiated a period of almost four decades of independence.
text: The 13th Dalai Lama proclaims Tibetan independence following a period of domination by Manchu Qing dynasty and initiated a period of almost four decades of independence.

title: Copyright: In New York City the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers is established to protect the copyrighted musical compositions of its members.
text: Copyright: In New York City the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers is established to protect the copyrighted musical compositions of its members.

title: The Negro National League is formed.
text: The Negro National League is formed.

title: The British Raj completes its transfer from Calcutta to New Delhi.
text: The British Raj completes its transfer from Calcutta to New Delhi.

title: A jury in Flemington, New Jersey finds Bruno Hauptmann guilty of the 1932 kidnapping and murder of the Lindbergh baby, the son of Charles Lindbergh.
text: A jury in Flemington, New Jersey finds Bruno Hauptmann guilty of the 1932 kidnapping and murder of the Lindbergh baby, the son of Charles Lindbergh.

title: World War II: The siege of Budapest concludes with the unconditional surrender of German and Hungarian forces to the Red Army.
text: World War II: The siege of Budapest concludes with the unconditional surrender of German and Hungarian forces to the Red Army.

title: World War II: Royal Air Force bombers are dispatched to Dresden, Germany to attack the city with a massive aerial bombardment.
text: World War II: Royal Air Force bombers are dispatched to Dresden, Germany to attack the city with a massive aerial bombardment.

title: Korean War: Battle of Chipyong-ni, which represented the "high-water mark" of the Chinese incursion into South Korea, commences.
text: Korean War: Battle of Chipyong-ni, which represented the "high-water mark" of the Chinese incursion into South Korea, commences.

title: Frank Selvy becomes the only NCAA Division I basketball player ever to score 100 points in a single game.
text: Frank Selvy becomes the only NCAA Division I basketball player ever to score 100 points in a single game.

title: Israel obtains four of the seven Dead Sea Scrolls.
text: Israel obtains four of the seven Dead Sea Scrolls.

title: With the success of a nuclear test codenamed "Gerboise Bleue", France becomes the fourth country to possess nuclear weapons.
text: With the success of a nuclear test codenamed "Gerboise Bleue", France becomes the fourth country to possess nuclear weapons.

title: Black college students stage the first of the Nashville sit-ins at three lunch counters in Nashville, Tennessee.
text: Black college students stage the first of the Nashville sit-ins at three lunch counters in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: An allegedly 500,000-year-old rock is discovered near Olancha, California, US, that appears to anachronistically encase a spark plug.
text: An allegedly 500,000-year-old rock is discovered near Olancha, California, US, that appears to anachronistically encase a spark plug.

title: American researchers discover the Madrid Codices by Leonardo da Vinci in the National Library of Spain.
text: American researchers discover the Madrid Codices by Leonardo da Vinci in the National Library of Spain.

title: Fire at the World Trade Center in New York.
text: Fire at the World Trade Center in New York.

title: Hilton bombing: a bomb explodes in a refuse truck outside the Hilton Hotel in Sydney, Australia, killing two refuse collectors and a policeman.
text: Hilton bombing: a bomb explodes in a refuse truck outside the Hilton Hotel in Sydney, Australia, killing two refuse collectors and a policeman.

title: An intense windstorm strikes western Washington and sinks a 1/2-mile-long section of the Hood Canal Bridge.
text: An intense windstorm strikes western Washington and sinks a 1/2-mile-long section of the Hood Canal Bridge.

title: A series of sewer explosions destroys more than two miles of streets in Louisville, Kentucky.
text: A series of sewer explosions destroys more than two miles of streets in Louisville, Kentucky.

title: A cinema fire in Turin, Italy, kills 64 people.
text: A cinema fire in Turin, Italy, kills 64 people.

title: Konstantin Chernenko succeeds the late Yuri Andropov as general secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.
text: Konstantin Chernenko succeeds the late Yuri Andropov as general secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

title: German reunification: An agreement is reached on a two-stage plan to reunite Germany.
text: German reunification: An agreement is reached on a two-stage plan to reunite Germany.

title: Gulf War: Two laser-guided "smart bombs" destroy the Amiriyah shelter in Baghdad. Allied forces said the bunker was being used as a military communications outpost, but over 400 Iraqi civilians inside were killed.
text: Gulf War: Two laser-guided "smart bombs" destroy the Amiriyah shelter in Baghdad. Allied forces said the bunker was being used as a military communications outpost, but over 400 Iraqi civilians inside were killed.

title: The Nepalese Civil War is initiated in the Kingdom of Nepal by the Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist-Centre).
text: The Nepalese Civil War is initiated in the Kingdom of Nepal by the Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist-Centre).

title: An earthquake measuring 7.6 on the Richter magnitude scale hits El Salvador, killing at least 944.
text: An earthquake measuring 7.6 on the Richter magnitude scale hits El Salvador, killing at least 944.

title: The Harvard–Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics announces the discovery of the universe's largest known diamond, white dwarf star BPM 37093. Astronomers named this star "Lucy" after The Beatles' song "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds".
text: The Harvard–Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics announces the discovery of the universe's largest known diamond, white dwarf star BPM 37093. Astronomers named this star "Lucy" after The Beatles' song "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds".

title: Taiwan opposition leader Ma Ying-jeou resigns as the chairman of the Kuomintang party after being indicted on charges of embezzlement during his tenure as the mayor of Taipei; Ma also announces his candidacy for the 2008 presidential election.
text: Taiwan opposition leader Ma Ying-jeou resigns as the chairman of the Kuomintang party after being indicted on charges of embezzlement during his tenure as the mayor of Taipei; Ma also announces his candidacy for the 2008 presidential election.

title: Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd makes a historic apology to the Indigenous Australians and the Stolen Generations.
text: Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd makes a historic apology to the Indigenous Australians and the Stolen Generations.

title: A bomb explodes in the city of Pune, Maharashtra, India, killing 17 and injuring 60 more.
text: A bomb explodes in the city of Pune, Maharashtra, India, killing 17 and injuring 60 more.

title: For the first time in more than 100 years the Umatilla, an American Indian tribe, are able to hunt and harvest a bison just outside Yellowstone National Park, restoring a centuries-old tradition guaranteed by a treaty signed in 1855.
text: For the first time in more than 100 years the Umatilla, an American Indian tribe, are able to hunt and harvest a bison just outside Yellowstone National Park, restoring a centuries-old tradition guaranteed by a treaty signed in 1855.

title: The European Space Agency (ESA) conducted the first launch of the European Vega rocket from Europe's spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana.
text: The European Space Agency (ESA) conducted the first launch of the European Vega rocket from Europe's spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana.

title: Kim Jong-nam, brother of North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Un, is assassinated at Kuala Lumpur International Airport.
